thread.title: China’s Changing Tastes Offer Upside for Coffee
thread.title_full: China’s Changing Tastes Offer Upside for Coffee - WSJ

author: Lucy Craymer
title: China’s Changing Tastes Offer Upside for Coffee
text:
HONG KONG—California-born Jim Lee moved to China four years ago to open a gourmet coffee and tea shop.
His Ocean Grounds store, which sells lattes for 38 yuan ($5.97) each, has seen booming traffic that has broadened over that time. The clientele began largely as urbane young Chinese professionals and expats, but now ranges from “younger people to old people—it’s really hard to say” who our average customer is, Mr. Lee said. “This...
